content.description: Proud line on the NW corner of the Gendarme Boulder(the biggest one). Sit down start in crack feature leads to small edges on the tall vertical face. Just enough features to slap for a sloper before you slip and slide.

Another good highball on the North face of the Gendarme, just to the right of Black Tide. This problem is a mirror image of Black Tide to the left, climbing similar features, but with the opposite hands.
content.location: Center of the North face of the Gendarme. Climbs over bulge just to the right of Black Tide.

content.description: Yet another frightening highball on the North face of the Gendarme. Climb hard to use micro-features until you can slap desperately for a big flat ledge up high.
content.location: Between Rip Tide and Slip n' Slide on the North face of the Gendarme.

content.description: Start two small crimps and high right foot. Bust up for thumb catch undercling and work right to slopey undercling and right hand thumb mono on the hole used in slip n slide. Hard move to gain half moon and even harder to mantle. Work directly left after mantle out to jug and top out up ramp. Or shoot straight up for a little LESS exhileration.

Follow the broken crack feature in the center of the overhanging face, with sick moves to stick a brick-like pinch and bomber fingerlock at the top. Begin from a sit start at a left hand block and right hand fingerlock. Rudimentary crack climbing technique is helpful.
content.protection: A few pads are real nice for the obstacles in the landing, including a close slab that rises up behind you.
content.location: The overhanging backside of the Gendarme boulder, to the right of Alien Baby

content.description: Start on the left side of the SE arete, left of Sai Baba, traverse right, around the entire boulder set, and finish on Stems and Seeds. Cruxes at the start, at lip of North face, on the steep West face, and finally Stems and Seeds.

Start low with a left hand sidepull/undercling, right hand sidepull edge, and a good crack for the left foot. Perform large tension moves with good holds to a crux going to the lip. Move left and top out on Crack Factory. Easier if youâ€™re taller.
content.protection: Can be done with three pads but four is best. Kind of a funky landing.
content.location: In between Crack Factory and Big Sexy.

content.description: Highball problem on the North face of the Gendarme. Climb the flat slab up to the black roof/bulge. Use an undercling to reach far for a good incut sidepull, reach for a fingerbucket, then top-out on huge jugs. Wander up some 5.6 to the top of the boulder.
content.location: North face of the Gendarme boulder - left side.

content.description: This is the hardest problem at the Anvils, to my knowledge. Start at the left edge of the enormous scooped face with a wide span. Make a huge throw to slopers on the block, then pull left with powerful shoulder moves to the left-facing lip and mantel.
content.protection: Pads (a few would be nice) and attentive spotting.
content.location: The steep uphill side of the Gendarme boulder. Begins at far right, just left of the large blank face.

content.description: This is the right variation of Alien Baby. Start with jams in the block and reach to the flat triangular sloper. Instead of breaking left to the good crimp, head directly to the sloping lip using some combination of a poor pinch and tiny edge. Steep and powerful.
content.protection: Pads and spotters- watch the rocks in the landing.
content.location: On the backside of the first huge boulder at the Anvils, can't miss it.

content.description: This is the left (and original) version of Alien Baby. Start with good jams in the block and fire to the flat triangular sloper. Crank left to a nice crimp and go big for the lip. Fantastic rock and great moves.
content.protection: Pads and a spot, the landing is not all that great.
content.location: On the first humongous boulder at the Anvils, this is on the backside.

content.description: Climb Alien Abortion but instead of topping out via the crack, continue into Alien Baby Right. Sustained movement.
content.location: Starts left of the obvious Alien Baby start.

content.description: Start with right hand sloping underling and left hand sidepull. Make first move to decent left crimp and figure out a right trending sequence with crimps into the crack feature. Take the crack to the top but beware of the ass-breaker rock landing.
content.location: Directly to the left of Alien Baby.

content.description: This is the biggest boulder at the Anvils, boasting 13 problems.
